intro: Prunella vulgaris var. lanceolata, commonly known as narrowleaf selfheal, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in short, glandular hairs. The leaves are lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly toothed margin, and are arranged oppositely along the stem. Its flowers are blue to purple, forming dense spike-like clusters at the顶端 of the stems. This plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed sites.
